result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Alvarez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Alvarez was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: letter from R.W. Lyall & Company, Inc. dated 6/4/15 regarding Defendant
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert Alvarez in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information. Repeat enhancer is stricken.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - 263 days)    *Concurrent*      **TIME SERVED**

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid by serving alternate 5 days - credit for 5 days) - TIME SERVED)
**Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation.**
Dated 05/07/15, from Atty Bricco to Judge Carter, requesting plea/sentencing date.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert Alvarez in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bricco requests a jury status and juyr trial date.  Case called for bail motion hearing.  Attorney Bricco makes statements/argument regarding bail.  State objects to any bail modification.  Court denies request.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on March 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  No contact with co-defendant listed in criminal complaint.  Defendant allowed huber bailee status.  NOTE:  There is also $2,500.00 cash bail set on this case.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  No contact with co-defendant listed in criminal complaint. MODIFIED CONDITION:  Defendant allowed huber bailee status.  NOTE:  Defendant is also required to sign $1,000.00 signature bond.

Defendant Robert Alvarez in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law by Bryan Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion to modify bail.  Attorney Bricco brings motion to modify bail.  Court will grants request for huber bailee status and also imposes an additional $1,000.00 signature bond, same conditions as previously set (with huber bailee status added).  Attorney Bricco withdraws speedy trial demand.  Court sets case for motion to sever.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
